statement.tex: %text Find the equation of the tangent to the curve \[ x = \sin 3t, y = \cos 2t \] at \[ t = \frac\pi{4} \] %

options.tex:
%text The required tangent will pass through the point
\[ \qquad A = \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}},0 \right)\] %

%text The required tangent will pass through the points
\[ \underbrace{A = \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}},0 \right)}_{t = \frac\pi{4}}\text{ and } \underbrace{B = \left(0,1\right)}_{t = 0}\] %

%text The slope of the required tangent $(m)$ will be
\[m = \left[\dfrac{dy}{dx}\right]_{t=\frac\pi{4}} = \left[\dfrac{dy / dt}{dx / dt}\right]_{t=\frac\pi{4}} = \frac{2\sqrt{2}}{3}\] %

%text The slope of the required tangent $(m)$ will be
\[m = \left[\dfrac{dy}{dx}\right]_{t=\frac\pi{4}} = \left[\dfrac{dy / dt}{dx / dt}\right]_{t=\frac\pi{4}} = -\frac{2\sqrt{2}}{3}\] %

%text And hence, the equation of the tangent will be
% \begin{align} \frac{y - 0}{x - \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}} &= \frac{2\sqrt{2}}{3} \\ \implies 3y &= 2\sqrt{2} x -2 \end{align}

%text And hence, the equation of the tangent will be
